problem: We have a rectangle of dimensions $x - 2$ by $2x + 5$ such that its area is $8x - 6$. What is the value of $x$?
solution:
We proceed as follows: \begin{align*}
(x - 2)(2x + 5) &= 8x - 6\\
2x^2 + x - 10 &= 8x - 6\\
2x^2 - 7x - 4 &= 0\\
(x - 4)(2x + 1) &= 0.
\end{align*}This gives us $x = 4$ or $x = -\frac{1}{2}.$ However, since the latter would make $x - 2$ negative, we see that $x = \boxed{4}.$
chatgpt_solution:
The area of a rectangle is equal to the length multiplied by the width, so the equation $(x - 2)(2x + 5) = 8x - 6$ must be satisfied. We expand the left side of the equation and further simplify by collecting like terms: \begin{align*}
(x - 2)(2x + 5) &= 8x - 6\\
2x^2+5x-4x-10&=8x-6\\
2x^2+x-10&=8x-6\\
2x^2-7x-4&=0
\end{align*} Factoring the quadratic or applying the quadratic formula can give us values of $x.$ The quadratic factors to $(2x + 1)(x-4) = 0,$ so either $2x+1=0$ or $x-4=0.$ If $2x+1=0,$ we find $x=\boxed{-\frac{1}{2}}.$ If $x-4=0,$ then $x=4,$ so $x=4$ is another solution to the equation.
